ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My speaking and writing skills developed amazingly throughout this course!
I developed insight on Korean social culture, music culture, and life in general.
I learned more advanced Korean vocabulary and grammar while analyzing kpop music.
Learned a lot of new grammar and vocabulary; how to express myself more articulately and more like a native in Korean
I continued to deepen my knowledge of Korean and Korean culture, with a focus on popular music.

I learned even more Korean grammar, writing, and speaking skills. In particular, I learned how to create a podcast in Korean introducing a song and 4 new sets of grammar that I mostly have not before. If I learned those grammar forms, then they were reinforced and thoroughly reviewed.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A major strength is its ability to fully immerse a student within the Korean language. From the beginning of class, the only language spoken--aside from clarification questions--is Korean. Although this can be stressful for some, it's important to understand (and you'll see if you take this course) that NO ONE fully understands everything said in class, and that's perfectly okay! If anything, it is expected! Otherwise, why are you in this class? Enroll for the next one! Coming from someone who's learning/knows 4-5 languages, just make sure to participate by taking notes and asking questions. Trust, you'll grow with time.
- There are no weaknesses to this course. It's fun, the workload is light, content is easy but helps you learn a lot.

Discovering a new song every week kept the class exciting, and gave everyone something to look forward to. There were only two main assignments, and the homework assignments could be quickly/easily completed. The class wasn't stress-inducing at all. I don't think there were any real weaknesses of this class--maybe we could have had more time to have one-on-one discussions with our classmates in Korean but considering the class is conducted entirely in Korean there was already a lot of immersion.
The strengths are the amazing Professor Lee, the small student size, amount of time we have dedicated to students' questions, and the flexibility we have for our projects.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100%! It's exactly the push I needed to further my Korean, rather than remaining lenient.
100% recommend this course to anyone interested in Korean culture and language in general. Lee seonsaengnim is literally the best person ever.
Yes!! Lee  is so nice and understanding and she makes the course a lot of fun!! As someone who isn't very engaged with kpop music, I still had a lot of fun and learned a lot with her!!

I highly recommend this course to another student because Professor Lee-Smith is very warm, engaging, and helpful when she gives you feedback. The discussions in the class are a fun way to continue learning Korean, and I found myself picking up more vocabulary by using it to speak on topics covered in the course.
YES! Lee Seonsaengnim is so fun, and if a student makes it this far in learning Korean, they have no reason to stop now.
I'd absolutely recommend this course to another student. The coursework is well organized and is tailored to engage students' non-academic interests to facilitate language learning.
Yes, I would highly recommend! You will not regret taking this class with Professor Lee.
